column1: ____ Ukrainian artillery artillery shells in Ukraine The Ukrainian Defence Minister's Office (DMA) says they could be used as "precision weapons" for the first time in Ukraine's history. "These are not a pre-programmed weapons," DMA spokesman Vitaly Churkin said in a statement. "They are more accurately called artillery shells as they are used for the first time by Ukraine. "We cannot imagine how such a move would be handled by the Ukrainian Defence Minister's Office." A spokesman for Poland's defence ministry said: "The Polish Defence Ministry does not discuss the plans or plans to carry out an exercise for the Ukrainian armed forces with the US." The US is an ally of Russia and is a member of the Security Council. The EU is hoping to bolster Ukraine against Russian aggression at the cost of the EU's "capacity to respond to Russia's aggression, and to respond to the threat".

The EU is also looking for other arms suppliers after the European Court of Justice said in April that it was not legally required for the EU to hand over to Russia an arms supply. "The Court of Justice has determined that in the case of the DNR [Defence and Security Council of Ukraine] the EU has a duty to ensure that the EU provides all arms relevant to the country in question and that the EU provides the necessary arms to the country in question. "The case is not binding and the EU's obligation to provide the required arms is not in question, and it is an important step in the negotiations. "It is a question of how much to ensure that Ukraine in the near future gets all its weapons and what kind of tools the EU has to provide those weapons to the country in question. European defence companies have a responsibility to ensure that Ukraine has the necessary arms and equipment. "We are not asking all of these arms for the country to provide. "We want to ensure that Ukraine has the necessary arms and equipment. The only way the EU can guarantee that Ukrainian companies will not be affected is when the Ukrainian government takes steps to ensure that the arms are available to the country in question.
